intro: Conyza evacioides, commonly known as the common ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Conyza evacioides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
